contextvariation.title: ContextVariation
contextvariation.description: A distinct test type or environmental context under which a coverage target may be invoked, used to parameterize test design across different execution conditions (functional correctness, load behavior, security posture, regression state). Maps to environmental needs documented in IEEE 829-2008 test design specifications.

contextType.description: The category of test context this variation represents

environmentFactors.description: References EnvironmentFactor nodes specifying the concrete environmental constraints (OS, locale, network, hardware, dependency versions) that define this context variation.

coverageexclusion.title: CoverageExclusion
coverageexclusion.description: A formally approved exclusion of a coverage target or requirement from the test coverage model, documenting the rationale, accepted risk, and accountable approver per test plan scope documentation in IEEE 829-2008.

affectedTargetRef.description: ID of the testing.testcoveragetarget or testing.coveragerequirement being excluded from coverage

dateApproved.description: ISO date when the exclusion was formally approved, supporting audit trail requirements

coveragegap.title: CoverageGap
coveragegap.description: An identified deficit between required and achieved test coverage for a target or requirement, typically surfaced during test summary reporting per IEEE 829-2008. Gaps require remediation, risk acceptance (CoverageExclusion), or deferral.

severity.description: Risk level of leaving this gap unaddressed

affectedRequirements.description: Identifier or reference to the requirement(s) that remain uncovered due to this gap.

remediationStatus.description: Lifecycle state of this coverage gap.

targetRef.description: ID of the testing.testcoveragetarget where this gap was identified

coveragerequirement.title: CoverageRequirement
coveragerequirement.description: A specification of coverage criteria that must be satisfied for a TestCoverageTarget, defining which input partitions, context variations, and outcome categories must be exercised, per test design specification requirements in IEEE 829-2008.

coverageCriteria.description: The coverage strategy defining which combinations of partition values must be exercised

priority.description: Relative importance of fulfilling this coverage requirement

coveragesummary.title: CoverageSummary
coveragesummary.description: Aggregated coverage status across all targets and requirements within a test coverage model, suitable for test summary reporting.

modelRef.description: ID of the testing.testcoveragemodel this summary aggregates

environmentfactor.title: EnvironmentFactor
environmentfactor.description: A specific environmental variable (OS version, network latency, locale setting, hardware configuration, dependency version) documented as affecting test behavior. Used to parameterize ContextVariation instances with concrete environmental constraints per IEEE 829-2008 environmental needs specification.

factorType.description: Category of environmental variable being documented.

value.description: The specific value or constraint for this factor (e.g., 'Ubuntu 22.04', 'latency < 100ms', 'en-US', 'Node.js 20.x').

expectedRange.description: Acceptable range or set of values for this factor in the test environment (e.g., 'latency 50-200ms', 'Ubuntu 20.04 or 22.04').

testImpact.description: Description of how variations in this factor are expected to affect test behavior or outcomes.

inputpartitionselection.title: InputPartitionSelection
inputpartitionselection.description: A specification of which values from an InputSpacePartition must be exercised within a CoverageRequirement, supporting selective coverage of equivalence classes per IEEE 829-2008 test design specification. When coverAllCategories is true, all partition values are included except those in excludeValues; otherwise, only the values listed in coverValues are included.

partitionRef.description: ID of the testing.inputspacepartition from which values are being selected for coverage.

coverValues.description: Comma-separated labels or IDs of specific partition values to include in coverage. Ignored when coverAllCategories is true.

coverAllCategories.description: When true, all partition values are included in coverage except those listed in excludeValues. Overrides coverValues.

excludeValues.description: Comma-separated labels or IDs of partition values to exclude from coverage. Applied when coverAllCategories is true to carve out specific values.

inputselection.title: InputSelection
inputselection.description: A concrete input value assignment for a TestCaseSketch, binding an abstract partition representative value (selectedValue) to a specific concrete test datum (concreteValue), per test case input specification in IEEE 829-2008.

valueSource.description: How the concrete value was obtained: manually authored, algorithmically generated, drawn from a data set, or loaded from a test fixture

inputspacepartition.title: InputSpacePartition
inputspacepartition.description: Partitioning of an input dimension into testable equivalence classes, where each entry in the partitions array represents a PartitionValue (an equivalence class with a label, category, and representative value), enabling structured coverage analysis per IEEE 829-2008 equivalence partitioning guidance.

presenceRule.description: Whether this input field must be present in test inputs for this partition

outcomecategory.title: OutcomeCategory
outcomecategory.description: An abstract category of observable outcomes (e.g., success, validation error, authorization error, timeout) associated with a TestCoverageTarget, used during test design to organize expected results before test case specification per IEEE 829-2008. Distinguished from specific assertions — OutcomeCategory defines the class of outcome, not the exact expected value.

outcomeType.description: The class of observable outcome this category represents, used to group test cases by expected result type for coverage analysis and reporting.

partitiondependency.title: PartitionDependency
partitiondependency.description: A constraint specifying how selection of a partition value in one field affects valid or available partition values in another field, enabling combinatorial test design to avoid invalid input combinations per IEEE 829-2008 test design specification.

dependsOnPartition.description: ID of the testing.inputspacepartition that triggers this dependency

dependsOnValue.description: Label or ID of the testing.partitionvalue that activates this dependency

effect.description: How the dependency affects the related partition values

affectedValues.description: Comma-separated labels or IDs of the partition values in the dependent field whose availability is modified by this dependency (e.g., values that are excluded, required, or restricted when the trigger value is selected).

partitionvalue.title: PartitionValue
partitionvalue.description: An individual equivalence class within an InputSpacePartition, characterized by a label, representative value, and optional constraint expression, used to enumerate the testable categories of an input dimension per IEEE 829-2008 test design specification.

category.description: Equivalence partition category for this value

targetcoveragesummary.title: TargetCoverageSummary
targetcoveragesummary.description: Coverage metrics summary for a single test coverage target

targetRef.description: ID of the testing.testcoveragetarget this summary covers

sketchCount.description: Total number of TestCaseSketch nodes for this target (design-time count; superset of implementedCount)

implementedCount.description: Number of sketches with a concrete test case implementation (must be ≤ sketchCount; superset of automatedCount)

automatedCount.description: Number of implemented test cases that are automated (must be ≤ implementedCount)

coveragePercentage.description: Percentage of coverage requirements with at least one implemented test case sketch (0–100)

targetinputfield.title: TargetInputField
targetinputfield.description: An association between a TestCoverageTarget and a specific input field of the target artifact, defining which InputSpacePartition applies to that field and documenting its coverage relevance per IEEE 829-2008 test case specification.

fieldRef.description: ID of the referenced field element in the API layer (e.g., an API parameter) or Data Model layer (e.g., a data-model property)

partitionRef.description: ID of the testing.inputspacepartition that defines the equivalence classes or boundary values for this input field.

relevance.description: Whether this field must be included in test case input specifications

testcasesketch.title: TestCaseSketch
testcasesketch.description: A design-time test case specification that selects concrete input partition values for a CoverageRequirement, serving as the bridge between test design (InputPartitionSelection) and executable test case specification per IEEE 829-2008. Exists in sketch (unimplemented) or implemented status — not yet tied to a specific test runner or execution framework.

status.description: Lifecycle status of the test case sketch

inputSelections.description: References InputPartitionSelection nodes specifying which partition values this sketch exercises.

implementationFormat.description: How the test case will be executed

source.description: Source code reference to the test case implementation

testcoveragemodel.title: TestCoverageModel
testcoveragemodel.description: The root artifact of a testing layer coverage specification, aggregating all TestCoverageTargets, InputSpacePartitions, ContextVariations, CoverageRequirements, and TestCaseSketches for an application. Corresponds to the test plan document structure in IEEE 829-2008, providing a single point of reference for coverage governance.

application.description: Cross-layer reference ID to the application or API element (application layer or api layer) being covered by this model

source.description: Provenance information indicating the origin of this model (e.g., manually authored, imported from OpenAPI, or generated from source artifacts)

testcoveragetarget.title: TestCoverageTarget
testcoveragetarget.description: An artifact or functionality that requires test coverage

targetType.description: The kind of artifact or functionality requiring test coverage

priority.description: Relative importance of achieving coverage for this target

source.description: Source code reference for the artifact requiring test coverage
